item.title: Roadmap
item.description: The project is in very early stages. While we haven’t set an official roadmap, some planned key features are: Multicluster support Secure comminication between control plane components (using Istio) Secure secret management: ensure secrets are only observed by services that are authorized to view them Isolation: ensure that no service is communication with an unauthorized party Modules for write-path: validate that exported data is in compliance with policies Istio-based blueprint: A typical blueprint to be supported in the near future would be composed of an Istio gateway to police egress traffic from the services running in the blurprint.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: The Mesh for Data is a cloud native platform to unify data access and governance, enabling business agility while securing enterprise data. By providing access and use of data only via the platform, The Mesh for Data brings together access and governance for data, greatly reducing risk of data loss.

item.title: Contribution Flow
item.description: Contributing to The Mesh for Data is done following the GitHub workflow for Pull Requests (PRs). You should usually open a pull request in the following situations: Submit trivial fixes (for example, a typo, a broken link or an obvious error) Start work on a contribution that was already asked for, or that you’ve already discussed, in an issue A pull request doesn’t have to represent finished work.

item.title: Development Environment
item.description: Currently, we officially support just OS X and Linux platforms. If you have a Windows machine consider using Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL), a remote Linux machine, or any other solution such as a virtual machine.
